greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Theta series of quadratic form x^2 + x*y + 17*y^2.
comment: Number of integer solutions (x, y) to x^2 + x*y + 17*y^2 = n. Also, a(n) is the number of integral elements with norm n in Q[sqrt(-67)].
link: Jianing Song, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
N. J. A. Sloane et al., Binary Quadratic Forms and OEIS
formula: G.f.: 1 + 2 * Sum_{k>0} Kronecker(-67, k) * x^k / (1 - x^k).
a(0) = 1, a(n) = 2 * b(n) for n > 0, where b() is multiplicative with b(67^e) = 1, b(p^e) = (1 + (-1)^e) / 2 if Kronecker(-67, p) = -1, b(p^e) = e + 1 if Kronecker(-67, p) = 1.
xref: Number of integer solutions to f(x,y) = n where f(x,y) is the principal binary quadratic form with discriminant d: A004016 (d=-3), A004018 (d=-4), A002652 (d=-7), A033715 (d=-8), A028609 (d=-11), A028641 (d=-19), A138811 (d=-43), this sequence (d=-67), A318985 (d=-163).
results.author: _Jianing Song_, Sep 06 2018
